content.description: Stand start using compression on both aretes. Climb the short slab and top out.
content.location: Far right of north facing outcropping within Granite Valley (North)

content.description: Sit start low on the north side of the boulder. Climb up the bulge, topping out at the apex.
content.location: Boulder will be seen on your left when entering Granite Valley (North)

content.description: Stand start with left hand gastone in 2/3 finger pocket and right hand side pull. Climb up using right arete features to a tricky top out.
content.location: On your left when entering Granite Valley (North)

content.description: Sit start matched on side pull in vertical crack. Climb up through decent holds along vertical crack and on the face, then top out.
content.location: Just right/behind Sharku, will appear on your left when entering Granite Valley (North)

content.description: Description: At about the midpoint within the state land between M-95 and Country Rd 607, there are two large valleys with a vast amount of bouldering potential. Routes in the north valley vary in height, but highball potential is there. Further development will require cleaning, and boulders on the west end of the valley may be more difficult to access due to standing water when temps are above freezing. Current developed routes are arranged L to R when facing south (looking at the boulders).
